title.narrative: Liberia - Programme d’appui à la réforme de la gestion des finances publiques I (PFMRSP-I) - (don supplémentaire)
Liberia - The Public Financial Management Reform Support Programme (PFMRSP-I) - (Additional Grant)

description.narrative: Le but principal du PFMRSP I porte sur quatre piliers: i) renforcer les systèmes de gestion des finances publiques (GFP) ; ii) moderniser la gestion des recettes ; iii) renforcer les systèmes de passation de marchés et d’audit ; et iv) contribuer au soutien des efforts du Gouvernement face à la crise alimentaire mondiale.

The overarching purpose of the PFMRSP I is to buttress four pillars: (i) strengthen public financial management (PFM) systems; (ii) modernize the revenue administration; (iii) reinforce procurement and audit systems; and (iv) support the government’s response to the global food crisis.

La présente intervention porte sur un appui supplémentaire de 3,386 millions d’UC destiné au programme d’appui à la réforme de la gestion des finances publiques I (PFMRSP I). L’assistance supplémentaire est proposée pour accorder un soutien budgétaire additionnel visant à aider le gouvernement à faire face aux conditions adverses et extraordinaires posées par la crise économique internationale actuelle (2009). Le PFMRSP I a été conçu en vue d'appuyer la codification des opérations budgétaires qui devrait permettre la transition au Système d’information intégré sur la gestion financière (IFMIS), alignant le système budgétaire de l’Etat à des normes admises au plan international. Il s'agit d'un programme en phase avec la Stratégie de Réduction de la Pauvreté (SRP) dans le cadre de laquelle le gouvernement a lancé un Programme de réforme de la Gestion des finances publiques à moyen terme et un programme de modernisation de l’administration fiscale. Le PFMRSP I devrait approfondir ces réformes en vue d’assurer l’efficacité du budget en améliorant son élaboration, son exécution, et son contrôle. Le présent programme comporte quatre composantes principales, à savoir: le renforcement du système de gestion des finances publiques; le renforcement de la mobilisation des recettes; l'amélioration du système d'approvisionnement et d'audit; ainsi que l'aide au gouvernement afin de répondre à la crise alimentaire mondiale.

The present intervention concerns the supplementary support of UA 3.386 million to Liberia’s Public Financial Management Reform Support Programme (PFMRSP) I. The proposed supplementary assistance provides additional budget support to help the government cope with the extraordinary adverse conditions posed by the current international economic crisis (2009). The PFMRSP I is designed to support the codification of budget operations that should allow the transition to the Integrated Financial Management Information System (IFMIS), aligning the state budget system with internationally accepted standards. It's a program in line with the Poverty Reduction Strategy (PRS) in which the government launched a medium-term PFM Reform Program and a program to modernize FISC administration. The PFMRSP I should deepen these reforms to ensure budget effectiveness by improving its development, implementation, and monitoring. This programme comprises four main components, namely: strengthening of public financial management system; strengthening revenue mobilization; enhancing procurement and auditing system and assisting the government to respond to the global food crisis.

Le programme devrait bénéficier au Ministère des Finances et à d'autres institutions clés leur permettant d'accélérer la mise en œuvre du processus de réforme. Il devrait également bénéficier à la population libérienne grâce à l'amélioration de la prestation des services publics et à la promotion d'un environnement propice au développement du secteur privé.

The program should benefit the Ministry of Finance and other key institutions to accelerate the implementation of the reform process. It's also expected to benefit the Liberian people by improving the delivery of public services and promoting an enabling environment for private sector development.

participating-org.narrative: GOVERNMENT OF LIBERIA MINISTRY OF FINANCE

mailing-address.narrative: African Development Bank Group Headquarters Avenue Joseph Anoma 01 BP 1387 Abidjan 01, Côte d'Ivoire

title.narrative: Information on total aid flows being provided on a monthly basis

target.value: Information on total aid flows being provided on a monthly basis by September 2009

actual.value: Aid flows are being published quarterly

title.narrative: Establishment and fully competent staffing of an IT department to support the various new software programs

actual.value: An IT department has been established, a Director has been recruited and is actively managing the department

title.narrative: Internal audits being applied in key ministries

target.value: Internal audits being applied in key ministries by end-June

actual.value: An Internal Audit Strategy has been approved but the internal audits have not yet been implemented

title.narrative: Risk management systems implemented and post audit systems enhanced

actual.value: Fifteen new auditors have been recruited for the internal audit units and a candidate shortlist for the internal audit director (to be financed by the WB) is being prepared

title.narrative: Integrated Financial Management Information System (IFMIS) starts being used in all relevant Ministry of Finance (MoF) departments

target.value: IMFIS starts being used in all relevant MoF departments; network installed by end-March 2009

actual.value: Installation of the LAN has been delayed, even beyond what was expected when the supplemental report was prepared. The LAN is now expected to be ready by March 2010.

title.narrative: Integrated tax administration System (ITAS) and Automated Systems for Customs Data (ASYCUDA) project teams established

actual.value: Project teams and project manager in place for ASYCUDA, but not for ITAS, because of the delay in no-objection from the WB. The ITAS functional project team has been established but the technical team is not complete. Staff is being recruited for the technical team, a project manager has been recruited and is expected to be effective as of October

title.narrative: Budget starts providing information on donor aid flows

actual.value: The 2009/2010 budget contains a comprehensive annex on project aid flows

title.narrative: Merging Bureau of Budget with the Ministry of Finance (MoF)

actual.value: The Bureau of Budget (BoB) has been incorporated in the Ministry of Finance, however, the physical relocation has not taken place because of space constraints

title.narrative: Macro-Fiscal Unit (MFU) increasingly performing core functions and linking budget to Medium Term Fiscal Framework (MTFF)

actual.value: The MFU is staffed and the MTFF was prepared for 2009 but not used to complement the FY2009/10 budget
The One Stop Shop has been operationalized

title.narrative: Implementation of the Public Financial Management (PFM) law

actual.value: The PFM law was submitted to parliament in November 2008 and approved in August 2009

target.value: PSI exit strategy in existence within six months from date of PSI contract

actual.value: The PSI exit strategy has not been developed (the PSI contract has not been rewarded)

title.narrative: A reduction in the import tax on rice and tariffs for agricultural inputs

actual.value: The authorities comprehensive food strategy continues to include suspended import duties on rice (at an estimated cost of 0.9 percent of GDP in lost revenues) and agricultural inputs

title.narrative: Regional experts help produce successive external audits of five ministries

target.value: Regional experts help produce successive external audits of five ministries by end-June

actual.value: The first round of audits was sent to Parliament in May, 2009, and a second (for 2007/2008) is underway and is expected to be terminated towards end of October, 2009
